33/** A code generator that emits Hexagon code from a given Halide stmt. */
34class CodeGen_Hexagon : public CodeGen_Posix {
35public:
36 /** Create a Hexagon code generator for the given Hexagon target. */
37 CodeGen_Hexagon(const Target &);
38
39protected:
40 void compile_func(const LoweredFunc &f,
41 const std::string &simple_name, const std::string &extern_name) override;
42
43 void init_module() override;
44
45 std::string mcpu() const override;
46 std::string mattrs() const override;
47 int isa_version;
48 bool use_soft_float_abi() const override;
49 int native_vector_bits() const override;
50
51 llvm::Function *define_hvx_intrinsic(llvm::Function *intrin, Type ret_ty,
52 const std::string &name,
53 std::vector<Type> arg_types,
54 int flags);
55
56 int is_hvx_v65_or_later() const {
57 return (isa_version >= 65);
58 }
59
60 using CodeGen_Posix::visit;
61
62 /** Nodes for which we want to emit specific hexagon intrinsics */
63 ///@{
64 void visit(const Max *) override;
65 void visit(const Min *) override;
66 void visit(const Call *) override;
67 void visit(const Mul *) override;
68 void visit(const Select *) override;
69 void visit(const Allocate *) override;
70 ///@}
71
72 /** We ask for an extra vector on each allocation to enable fast
73 * clamped ramp loads. */
74 int allocation_padding(Type type) const override {
75 return CodeGen_Posix::allocation_padding(type) + native_vector_bits() / 8;
76 }
77
78 /** Call an LLVM intrinsic, potentially casting the operands to
79 * match the type of the function. */
80 ///@{
81 llvm::Value *call_intrin_cast(llvm::Type *ret_ty, llvm::Function *F,
82 std::vector<llvm::Value *> Ops);
83 llvm::Value *call_intrin_cast(llvm::Type *ret_ty, int id,
84 std::vector<llvm::Value *> Ops);
85 ///@}
86
87 /** Define overloads of CodeGen_LLVM::call_intrin that determine
88 * the intrin_lanes from the type, and allows the function to
89 * return null if the maybe option is true and the intrinsic is
90 * not found. */
91 ///@{
92 llvm::Value *call_intrin(Type t, const std::string &name,
93 std::vector<Expr>, bool maybe = false);
94 llvm::Value *call_intrin(llvm::Type *t, const std::string &name,
95 std::vector<llvm::Value *>, bool maybe = false);
96 ///@}
97
98 /** Override CodeGen_LLVM to use hexagon intrinics when possible. */
99 ///@{
100 llvm::Value *interleave_vectors(const std::vector<llvm::Value *> &v) override;
101 llvm::Value *shuffle_vectors(llvm::Value *a, llvm::Value *b,
102 const std::vector<int> &indices) override;
103 using CodeGen_Posix::shuffle_vectors;
104 ///@}
105
106 /** Generate a LUT lookup using vlut instructions. */
107 ///@{
108 llvm::Value *vlut(llvm::Value *lut, llvm::Value *indices, int min_index = 0, int max_index = 1 << 30);
109 llvm::Value *vlut(llvm::Value *lut, const std::vector<int> &indices);
110 ///@}
111
112 llvm::Value *vdelta(llvm::Value *lut, const std::vector<int> &indices);
113
114 /** Because HVX intrinsics operate on vectors of i32, using them
115 * requires a lot of extraneous bitcasts, which make it difficult
116 * to manipulate the IR. This function avoids generating redundant
117 * bitcasts. */
118 llvm::Value *create_bitcast(llvm::Value *v, llvm::Type *ty);
119
120private:
121 /** Generates code for computing the size of an allocation from a
122 * list of its extents and its size. Fires a runtime assert
123 * (halide_error) if the size overflows 2^31 -1, the maximum
124 * positive number an int32_t can hold. */
125 llvm::Value *codegen_cache_allocation_size(const std::string &name, Type type, const std::vector<Expr> &extents);
126
127 /** Generate a LUT (8/16 bit, max_index < 256) lookup using vlut instructions. */
128 llvm::Value *vlut256(llvm::Value *lut, llvm::Value *indices, int min_index = 0, int max_index = 255);
129};
130
131CodeGen_Hexagon::CodeGen_Hexagon(const Target &t)
132 : CodeGen_Posix(t) {
133 if (target.has_feature(Halide::Target::HVX_v66)) {
134 isa_version = 66;
135 } else if (target.has_feature(Halide::Target::HVX_v65)) {
136 isa_version = 65;
137 } else {
138 isa_version = 62;
139 }
140 user_assert(target.has_feature(Target::HVX))
141 << "Creating a Codegen target for Hexagon without the hvx target feature.\n";
142}
143
144Stmt call_halide_qurt_hvx_lock(const Target &target) {
145 Expr hvx_lock =
146 Call::make(Int(32), "halide_qurt_hvx_lock", {}, Call::Extern);
147 string hvx_lock_result_name = unique_name("hvx_lock_result");
148 Expr hvx_lock_result_var = Variable::make(Int(32), hvx_lock_result_name);
149 Stmt check_hvx_lock = LetStmt::make(
150 hvx_lock_result_name, hvx_lock,
151 AssertStmt::make(EQ::make(hvx_lock_result_var, 0), hvx_lock_result_var));
152 return check_hvx_lock;
153}
154
155Stmt call_halide_qurt_hvx_unlock() {
156 Expr hvx_unlock =
157 Call::make(Int(32), "halide_qurt_hvx_unlock", {}, Call::Extern);
158 string hvx_unlock_result_name = unique_name("hvx_unlock_result");
159 Expr hvx_unlock_result_var = Variable::make(Int(32), hvx_unlock_result_name);
160 Stmt check_hvx_unlock =
161 LetStmt::make(hvx_unlock_result_name, hvx_unlock,
162 AssertStmt::make(EQ::make(hvx_unlock_result_var, 0),
163 hvx_unlock_result_var));
164 return check_hvx_unlock;
165}
166
167// Wrap the stmt in a call to qurt_hvx_lock, calling qurt_hvx_unlock
168// as a destructor if successful.
169Stmt acquire_hvx_context(Stmt stmt, const Target &target) {
170 // Modify the stmt to add a call to halide_qurt_hvx_lock, and
171 // register a destructor to call halide_qurt_hvx_unlock.
172 Stmt check_hvx_lock = call_halide_qurt_hvx_lock(target);
173 Expr dummy_obj = reinterpret(Handle(), cast<uint64_t>(1));
174 Expr hvx_unlock =
175 Call::make(Handle(), Call::register_destructor,
176 {Expr("halide_qurt_hvx_unlock_as_destructor"), dummy_obj},
177 Call::Intrinsic);
178
179 stmt = Block::make(Evaluate::make(hvx_unlock), stmt);
180 stmt = Block::make(check_hvx_lock, stmt);
181 return stmt;
182}
183
184bool is_dense_ramp(const Expr &x) {
185 const Ramp *r = x.as<Ramp>();
186 if (!r) {
187 return false;
188 }
189
190 return is_const_one(r->stride);
191}
192
193// In Hexagon, we assume that we can read one vector past the end of
194// buffers. Using this assumption, this mutator replaces vector
195// predicated dense loads with scalar predicated dense loads.
196class SloppyUnpredicateLoadsAndStores : public IRMutator {
197 using IRMutator::visit;
198
199 // The first and last lanes of all monotonic vectors in scope
200 Scope<std::pair<Expr, Expr>> monotonic_vectors;
201
202 // If a vector monotonically increases or decreases across the
203 // lanes, return the first and last lane.
204 std::pair<Expr, Expr> get_extreme_lanes(const Expr &e) {
205 if (const Ramp *r = e.as<Ramp>()) {
206 return {r->base, r->base + r->stride * (r->lanes - 1)};
207 } else if (const Broadcast *b = e.as<Broadcast>()) {
208 return {b->value, b->value};
209 } else if (const LT *op = e.as<LT>()) {
210 if (!op->a.type().is_bool()) {
211 auto a = get_extreme_lanes(op->a);
212 auto b = get_extreme_lanes(op->b);
213 if (a.first.defined() && b.first.defined()) {
214 return {a.first < b.first, a.second < b.second};
215 }
216 }
217 } else if (const LE *op = e.as<LE>()) {
218 if (!op->a.type().is_bool()) {
219 auto a = get_extreme_lanes(op->a);
220 auto b = get_extreme_lanes(op->b);
221 if (a.first.defined() && b.first.defined()) {
222 return {a.first <= b.first, a.second <= b.second};
223 }
224 }
225 } else if (const Variable *op = e.as<Variable>()) {
226 if (monotonic_vectors.contains(op->name)) {
227 return monotonic_vectors.get(op->name);
228 }
229 } else if (const Let *op = e.as<Let>()) {
230 auto v = get_extreme_lanes(op->value);
231 ScopedBinding<std::pair<Expr, Expr>> bind(v.first.defined(), monotonic_vectors, op->name, v);
232 return get_extreme_lanes(op->body);
233 }
234 return {Expr(), Expr()};
235 }
236
237 Expr visit(const Let *op) override {
238 auto v = get_extreme_lanes(op->value);
239 ScopedBinding<std::pair<Expr, Expr>> bind(op->value.type().is_vector() && v.first.defined(),
240 monotonic_vectors, op->name, v);
241 return IRMutator::visit(op);
242 }
243
244 Expr visit(const Load *op) override {
245 if (is_const_one(op->predicate)) {
246 // These are handled fine
247 return IRMutator::visit(op);
248 }
249
250 Expr predicate = mutate(op->predicate);
251 Expr index = mutate(op->index);
252
253 if (is_dense_ramp(index) || index.as<Broadcast>()) {
254 // Make the predicate into a scalar that is true if any of the lanes are
255 // true.
256
257 Expr condition;
258
259 // If the predicate is monotonic increasing or decreasing
260 // over the vector lanes, we can just check the last or
261 // first lane, respectively. We won't bother to
262 // distinguish between the two cases though, so we just or
263 // them both together.
264 auto v = get_extreme_lanes(predicate);
265 if (v.first.defined()) {
266 internal_assert(v.first.type() == Bool() &&
267 v.second.type() == Bool())
268 << "The extreme lanes of a bool vector should be scalar bools\n";
269 condition = simplify(v.first || v.second);
270 } else {
271 // Take an OR over all lanes.
272 condition = VectorReduce::make(VectorReduce::Or, predicate, 1);
273 condition = simplify(condition);
274 }
275
276 Expr load = Load::make(op->type, op->name, index, op->image, op->param,
277 const_true(op->type.lanes()), op->alignment);
278
279 return Call::make(op->type, Call::if_then_else,
280 {condition, load, make_zero(op->type)}, Call::Intrinsic);
281 } else {
282 // It's a predicated vector gather. Just scalarize. We'd
283 // prefer to keep it in a loop, but that would require
284 // some sort of loop Expr. Another option would be
285 // introducing a set of runtime functions to do predicated
286 // loads.
287 Expr load = Load::make(op->type, op->name, index, op->image, op->param,
288 const_true(op->type.lanes()), op->alignment);
289 return Call::make(op->type, Call::if_then_else,
290 {predicate, load, make_zero(op->type)}, Call::Intrinsic);
291 }
292 }
293
294 Stmt visit(const Store *op) override {
295 if (is_const_one(op->predicate)) {
296 return IRMutator::visit(op);
297 }
298
299 Expr predicate = mutate(op->predicate);
300 Expr value = mutate(op->value);
301 Expr index = mutate(op->index);
302
303 int lanes = value.type().lanes();
304
305 if (const Broadcast *scalar_pred = predicate.as<Broadcast>()) {
306 Stmt unpredicated_store = Store::make(op->name, value, index, op->param, const_true(lanes), op->alignment);
307 return IfThenElse::make(scalar_pred->value, unpredicated_store);
308 } else {
309 string value_name = unique_name("scalarized_store_value");
310 string index_name = unique_name("scalarized_store_index");
311 string predicate_name = unique_name("scalarized_store_predicate");
312
313 const Ramp *index_ramp = index.as<Ramp>();
314
315 // Store entire vectors to the stack
316 vector<Stmt> stmts;
317 Expr predicate_mask = select(predicate, make_one(UInt(8, lanes)), make_zero(UInt(8, lanes)));
318 stmts.emplace_back(Store::make(predicate_name, predicate_mask, Ramp::make(0, 1, lanes),
319 Parameter(), const_true(lanes),
320 ModulusRemainder()));
321 stmts.emplace_back(Store::make(value_name, value, Ramp::make(0, 1, lanes),
322 Parameter(), const_true(lanes),
323 ModulusRemainder()));
324 if (!index_ramp) {
325 stmts.emplace_back(Store::make(index_name, index, Ramp::make(0, 1, lanes),
326 Parameter(), const_true(lanes),
327 ModulusRemainder()));
328 }
329
330 // Then load each element one by one in a loop and do a conditional scalar store
331 string lane_name = unique_name('t');
332 Expr lane_var = Variable::make(Int(32), lane_name);
333
334 Expr pred_i = Load::make(UInt(8), predicate_name, lane_var,
335 Buffer<>(), Parameter(), const_true(), ModulusRemainder());
336 Expr value_i = Load::make(value.type().element_of(), value_name, lane_var,
337 Buffer<>(), Parameter(), const_true(), ModulusRemainder());
338 Expr index_i;
339 if (index_ramp) {
340 index_i = index_ramp->base + lane_var * index_ramp->stride;
341 } else {
342 index_i = Load::make(Int(32), index_name, lane_var,
343 Buffer<>(), Parameter(), const_true(), ModulusRemainder());
344 }
345
346 Stmt store_lanes = Store::make(op->name, value_i, index_i,
347 op->param, const_true(),
348 ModulusRemainder());
349 store_lanes = IfThenElse::make(pred_i != 0, store_lanes);
350 store_lanes = For::make(lane_name, 0, lanes,
351 ForType::Serial, DeviceAPI::None, store_lanes);
352 stmts.emplace_back(std::move(store_lanes));
353
354 Stmt result = Block::make(stmts);
355
356 // Wrap with allocate nodes
357
358 result = Allocate::make(predicate_name, UInt(8), MemoryType::Stack,
359 {predicate.type().lanes()}, const_true(), result);
360 if (!index_ramp) {
361 result = Allocate::make(index_name, Int(32), MemoryType::Stack,
362 {index.type().lanes()}, const_true(), result);
363 }
364 result = Allocate::make(value_name, value.type().element_of(), MemoryType::Stack,
365 {value.type().lanes()}, const_true(), result);
366
367 return result;
368 }
369 }
370};
371
372Stmt sloppy_unpredicate_loads_and_stores(const Stmt &s) {
373 return SloppyUnpredicateLoadsAndStores().mutate(s);
374}
375
376class InjectHVXLocks : public IRMutator {
377public:
378 InjectHVXLocks(const Target &t)
379 : target(t) {
380 uses_hvx_var = Variable::make(Bool(), "uses_hvx");
381 }
382 bool uses_hvx = false;
383
384private:
385 Expr uses_hvx_var;
386 using IRMutator::visit;
387 // Primarily, we do two things when we encounter a parallel for loop.
388 // First, we check if the paralell for loop uses_hvx and accordingly
389 // acqure_hvx_context i.e. acquire and release HVX locks.
390 // Then we insert a conditional unlock before the for loop, let's call
391 // this the prolog, and a conditional lock after the for loop which
392 // we shall call the epilog. So the code for a parallel loop that uses
393 // hvx should look like so.
394 //
395 // if (uses_hvx_var) {
396 // halide_qurt_hvx_unlock();
397 // }
398 // parallel_for {
399 // halide_qurt_hvx_lock();
400 // ...
401 // ...
402 // halide_qurt_hvx_unlock();
403 // }
404 // if (uses_hvx_var) {
405 // halide_qurt_hvx_lock();
406 // }
407 //
408 // When we move up to the enclosing scope we substitute the value of uses_hvx
409 // into the IR that should convert the conditionals to constants.
410 Stmt visit(const For *op) override {
411 if (op->for_type == ForType::Parallel) {
412 bool old_uses_hvx = uses_hvx;
413 uses_hvx = false;
414
415 Stmt body = mutate(op->body);
416 Stmt s;
417 if (uses_hvx) {
418 body = acquire_hvx_context(body, target);
419 body = substitute("uses_hvx", true, body);
420 Stmt new_for = For::make(op->name, op->min, op->extent, op->for_type,
421 op->device_api, body);
422 Stmt prolog =
423 IfThenElse::make(uses_hvx_var, call_halide_qurt_hvx_unlock());
424 Stmt epilog =
425 IfThenElse::make(uses_hvx_var, call_halide_qurt_hvx_lock(target));
426 s = Block::make({prolog, new_for, epilog});
427 debug(4) << "Wrapping prolog & epilog around par loop\n"
428 << s << "\n";
429 } else {
430 // We do not substitute false for "uses_hvx" into the body as we do in
431 // the true case because we want to defer that to an enclosing scope.
432 // The logic is that in case this scope doesn't use_hvx (we are here in
433 // the else because of that) then an enclosing scope might. However,
434 // substituting false for "uses_hvx" at this stage will remove the
435 // prolog and epilog checks that will be needed as the enclosing scope
436 // uses hvx. This is exhibited by the following code structure
437 //
438 // for_par(z..) {//uses hvx
439 // for_par(y..) { // doesn't use hvx
440 // for_par(x..) { // uses hvx
441 // vector code
442 // }
443 // }
444 // vector code
445 // }
446 // If we substitute false in the else here, we'll get
447 // for_par(z.) {
448 // halide_qurt_hvx_lock();
449 // for_par(y..) {
450 // if (false) {
451 // halide_qurt_hvx_unlock(); // will get optimized away.
452 // }
453 // for_par(x..) {
454 // halide_qurt_hvx_lock(); // double lock. Not good.
455 // vector code
456 // halide_qurt_hvx_unlock();
457 // }
458 // if (false) {
459 // halide_qurt_hvx_lock();
460 // }
461 // }
462 // vector code
463 // halide_qurt_unlock
464 // }
465 s = For::make(op->name, op->min, op->extent, op->for_type,
466 op->device_api, body);
467 }
468
469 uses_hvx = old_uses_hvx;
470 return s;
471 }
472 return IRMutator::visit(op);
473 }
474 Expr visit(const Variable *op) override {
475 uses_hvx = uses_hvx || op->type.is_vector();
476 return op;
477 }
478 Expr visit(const Ramp *op) override {
479 uses_hvx = uses_hvx || op->type.is_vector();
480 return op;
481 }
482 Expr visit(const Broadcast *op) override {
483 uses_hvx = uses_hvx || op->lanes > 1;
484 return op;
485 }
486 Expr visit(const Call *op) override {
487 uses_hvx = uses_hvx || op->type.is_vector();
488 return op;
489 }
490
491 Target target;
492};
493
494Stmt inject_hvx_lock_unlock(Stmt body, const Target &target) {
495 InjectHVXLocks i(target);
496 body = i.mutate(body);
497 if (i.uses_hvx) {
498 body = acquire_hvx_context(body, target);
499 }
500 body = substitute("uses_hvx", i.uses_hvx, body);
501 body = simplify(body);
502 return body;
503}
504
505void CodeGen_Hexagon::compile_func(const LoweredFunc &f,
506 const string &simple_name,
507 const string &extern_name) {
508 CodeGen_Posix::begin_func(f.linkage, simple_name, extern_name, f.args);
509
510 Stmt body = f.body;
511
512 debug(1) << "Unpredicating loads and stores...\n";
513 // Replace dense vector predicated loads with sloppy scalarized
514 // predicates, and scalarize predicated stores
515 body = sloppy_unpredicate_loads_and_stores(body);
516
517 debug(2) << "Lowering after unpredicating loads/stores:\n"
518 << body << "\n\n";
519
520 if (is_hvx_v65_or_later()) {
521 // Generate vscatter-vgathers before optimize_hexagon_shuffles.
522 debug(1) << "Looking for vscatter-vgather...\n";
523 body = scatter_gather_generator(body);
524 }
525
526 debug(1) << "Optimizing shuffles...\n";
527 // vlut always indexes 64 bytes of the LUT at a time, even in 128 byte mode.
528 const int lut_alignment = 64;
529 body = optimize_hexagon_shuffles(body, lut_alignment);
530 debug(2) << "Lowering after optimizing shuffles:\n"
531 << body << "\n\n";
532
533 debug(1) << "Aligning loads for HVX....\n";
534 body = align_loads(body, target.natural_vector_size(Int(8)));
535 body = common_subexpression_elimination(body);
536 // Don't simplify here, otherwise it will re-collapse the loads we
537 // want to carry across loop iterations.
538 debug(2) << "Lowering after aligning loads:\n"
539 << body << "\n\n";
540
541 debug(1) << "Carrying values across loop iterations...\n";
542 // Use at most 16 vector registers for carrying values.
543 body = loop_carry(body, 16);
544 body = simplify(body);
545 debug(2) << "Lowering after forwarding stores:\n"
546 << body << "\n\n";
547
548 // Optimize the IR for Hexagon.
549 debug(1) << "Optimizing Hexagon instructions...\n";
550 body = optimize_hexagon_instructions(body, target);
551
552 debug(1) << "Adding calls to qurt_hvx_lock, if necessary...\n";
553 body = inject_hvx_lock_unlock(body, target);
554
555 debug(1) << "Hexagon function body:\n";
556 debug(1) << body << "\n";
557
558 body.accept(this);
559
560 CodeGen_Posix::end_func(f.args);
561}
562
563struct HvxIntrinsic {
564 enum {
565 BroadcastScalarsToWords = 1 << 0, // Some intrinsics need scalar arguments
566 // broadcasted up to 32 bits.
567 v65OrLater = 1 << 1,
568 };
569 llvm::Intrinsic::ID id;
570 halide_type_t ret_type;
571 const char *name;
572 halide_type_t arg_types[4];
573 int flags;
574};
575
576// TODO: these should probably be declared constexpr, but that would
577// require marking various halide_type_t methods as constexpr, and an
578// obscure bug in MSVC2017 can cause compilation failures for them.
579// The bug appears to be fixed in MSVC2019, so when we move to that
580// as a baseline for Windows, this should be revisited.
581halide_type_t i8 = halide_type_t(halide_type_int, 8);
582halide_type_t i16 = halide_type_t(halide_type_int, 16);
583halide_type_t i32 = halide_type_t(halide_type_int, 32);
584halide_type_t u8 = halide_type_t(halide_type_uint, 8);
585halide_type_t u16 = halide_type_t(halide_type_uint, 16);
586halide_type_t u32 = halide_type_t(halide_type_uint, 32);
587
588// Define vectors that are 1x and 2x the Hexagon HVX width --
589// Note that we use placeholders here (which we fix up when processing
590// the table) as we don't know the HVX width until we know the target
591// we're using; this approach lets us make a compact table with static
592// data, rather than having to assemble it at runtime.
593constexpr int kOneX = 64 * 8;
594
595halide_type_t i8v1 = i8.with_lanes(kOneX / 8);
596halide_type_t i16v1 = i16.with_lanes(kOneX / 16);
597halide_type_t i32v1 = i32.with_lanes(kOneX / 32);
598halide_type_t u8v1 = u8.with_lanes(kOneX / 8);
599halide_type_t u16v1 = u16.with_lanes(kOneX / 16);
600halide_type_t u32v1 = u32.with_lanes(kOneX / 32);
601
602halide_type_t i8v2 = i8v1.with_lanes(i8v1.lanes * 2);
603halide_type_t i16v2 = i16v1.with_lanes(i16v1.lanes * 2);
604halide_type_t i32v2 = i32v1.with_lanes(i32v1.lanes * 2);
605halide_type_t u8v2 = u8v1.with_lanes(u8v1.lanes * 2);

607halide_type_t u32v2 = u32v1.with_lanes(u32v1.lanes * 2);

851 {INTRINSIC_128B(vaslw), u32v1, "shl.vuw.w", {u32v1, u32}},
852 {INTRINSIC_128B(vaslh), i16v1, "shl.vh.h", {i16v1, u16}},
853 {INTRINSIC_128B(vaslw), i32v1, "shl.vw.w", {i32v1, u32}},
854 {INTRINSIC_128B(vasrh_acc), i16v1, "add_shr.vh.vh.uh", {i16v1, i16v1, i16}, HvxIntrinsic::BroadcastScalarsToWords | HvxIntrinsic::v65OrLater},
855 {INTRINSIC_128B(vaslh_acc), i16v1, "add_shl.vh.vh.uh", {i16v1, i16v1, i16}, HvxIntrinsic::BroadcastScalarsToWords | HvxIntrinsic::v65OrLater},
856 {INTRINSIC_128B(vasrw_acc), i32v1, "add_shr.vw.vw.uw", {i32v1, i32v1, i32}},
857 {INTRINSIC_128B(vaslw_acc), i32v1, "add_shl.vw.vw.uw", {i32v1, i32v1, i32}},
858
859 {INTRINSIC_128B(vasrwh), i16v1, "trunc_shr.vw.uw", {i32v2, u32}},
860 {INTRINSIC_128B(vasrhubsat), u8v1, "trunc_satub_shr.vh.uh", {i16v2, u16}},
861 {INTRINSIC_128B(vasrwuhsat), u16v1, "trunc_satuh_shr.vw.uw", {i32v2, u32}},
862 {INTRINSIC_128B(vasrwhsat), i16v1, "trunc_sath_shr.vw.uw", {i32v2, u32}},
863 {INTRINSIC_128B(vror), u8v1, "vror", {u8v1, i32}},
864
865 // Bit counting
866 {INTRINSIC_128B(vnormamth), u16v1, "cls.vh", {u16v1}},
867 {INTRINSIC_128B(vnormamtw), u32v1, "cls.vw", {u32v1}},
868};
869// clang-format on
870
871// TODO: Many variants of the above functions are missing. They
872// need to be implemented in the runtime module, or via
873// fall-through to CodeGen_LLVM.
874
875void CodeGen_Hexagon::init_module() {
876 CodeGen_Posix::init_module();
877
878 // LLVM's HVX vector intrinsics don't include the type of the
879 // operands, they all operate on vectors of 32 bit integers. To make
880 // it easier to generate code, we define wrapper intrinsics with
881 // the correct type (plus the necessary bitcasts).
882 const auto fix_lanes = [&](const halide_type_t &t) -> halide_type_t {
883 if (t.lanes == 1) {
884 return t;
885 }
886 const int lanes_actual = ((int)t.lanes * native_vector_bits()) / kOneX;
887 return t.with_lanes(lanes_actual);
888 };
889
890 vector<Type> arg_types;
891 for (const HvxIntrinsic &i : intrinsic_wrappers) {
892 llvm::Intrinsic::ID id = i.id;
893 internal_assert(id != llvm::Intrinsic::not_intrinsic);
894 // Get the real intrinsic.
895 llvm::Function *intrin = llvm::Intrinsic::getDeclaration(module.get(), id);
896 halide_type_t ret_type = fix_lanes(i.ret_type);
897 arg_types.clear();
898 for (const auto &a : i.arg_types) {
899 if (a.bits == 0) {
900 break;
901 }
902 arg_types.emplace_back(fix_lanes(a));
903 }
904 define_hvx_intrinsic(intrin, ret_type, i.name, arg_types, i.flags);
905 }
906}
907
908llvm::Function *CodeGen_Hexagon::define_hvx_intrinsic(llvm::Function *intrin,
909 Type ret_ty,
910 const string &name,
911 vector<Type> arg_types,
912 int flags) {
913 internal_assert(intrin) << "Null definition for intrinsic '" << name << "'\n";
914 llvm::FunctionType *intrin_ty = intrin->getFunctionType();
915 bool broadcast_scalar_word = flags & HvxIntrinsic::BroadcastScalarsToWords;
916 bool v65OrLater = flags & HvxIntrinsic::v65OrLater;
917
918 if (v65OrLater && !is_hvx_v65_or_later()) {
919 return nullptr;
920 }
921
922 // Get the types of the arguments we want to pass.
923 vector<llvm::Type *> llvm_arg_types;
924 llvm_arg_types.reserve(arg_types.size());
925 for (Type i : arg_types) {
926 llvm_arg_types.push_back(llvm_type_of(i));
927 }
928
929 // Make a wrapper intrinsic.
930 llvm::FunctionType *wrapper_ty =
931 llvm::FunctionType::get(llvm_type_of(ret_ty), llvm_arg_types, false);
932 llvm::Function *wrapper =
933 llvm::Function::Create(wrapper_ty, llvm::GlobalValue::InternalLinkage,
934 "halide.hexagon." + name, module.get());
935 llvm::BasicBlock *block =
936 llvm::BasicBlock::Create(module->getContext(), "entry", wrapper);
937 IRBuilderBase::InsertPoint here = builder->saveIP();
938 builder->SetInsertPoint(block);
939
940 vector<Value *> args;
941 for (Value &arg : wrapper->args()) {
942 args.push_back(&arg);
943 }
944
945 if (args.size() + 1 == intrin_ty->getNumParams()) {
946 // This intrinsic needs the first argument split into the high and low
947 // vectors.
948 Value *dv = args[0];
949 int vec_lanes = native_vector_bits() / arg_types[0].bits();
950 Value *low = slice_vector(dv, 0, vec_lanes);
951 Value *high = slice_vector(dv, vec_lanes, vec_lanes);
952
953 args[0] = high;
954 args.insert(args.begin() + 1, low);
955
956 Type split_type =
957 arg_types.front().with_lanes(arg_types.front().lanes() / 2);
958 arg_types[0] = split_type;
959 arg_types.insert(arg_types.begin() + 1, split_type);
960 }
961
962 // Replace args with bitcasts if necessary.
963 internal_assert(args.size() == intrin_ty->getNumParams());
964 for (size_t i = 0; i < args.size(); i++) {
965 llvm::Type *arg_ty = intrin_ty->getParamType(i);
966 if (args[i]->getType() != arg_ty) {
967 if (arg_ty->isVectorTy()) {
968 args[i] = builder->CreateBitCast(args[i], arg_ty);
969 } else {
970 if (broadcast_scalar_word) {
971 llvm::Function *fn = nullptr;
972 // We know it is a scalar type. We can have 8 bit, 16 bit or 32 bit
973 // types only.
974 unsigned bits = arg_types[i].bits();
975 const char *fn_name = "";
976 switch (bits) {
977 case 8:
978 fn_name = "halide.hexagon.dup4.b";
979 break;
980 case 16:
981 fn_name = "halide.hexagon.dup2.h";
982 break;
983 default:
984 internal_error
985 << "unhandled broadcast_scalar_word in define_hvx_intrinsic";
986 }
987 fn = module->getFunction(fn_name);
988 internal_assert(fn) << "Unable to find function " << fn_name << " in define_hvx_intrinsic.";
989 args[i] = builder->CreateCall(fn, {args[i]});
990 } else if (args[i]->getType()->isIntegerTy()) {
991 args[i] =
992 builder->CreateIntCast(args[i], arg_ty, arg_types[i].is_int());
993 } else {
994 args[i] = builder->CreateBitCast(args[i], arg_ty);
995 }
996 }
997 }
998 }
999
1000 // Call the real intrinsic.
1001 Value *ret = builder->CreateCall(intrin, args);
1002
1003 // Cast the result, if necessary.
1004 if (ret->getType() != wrapper_ty->getReturnType()) {
1005 ret = builder->CreateBitCast(ret, wrapper_ty->getReturnType());
1006 }
1007
1008 builder->CreateRet(ret);
1009
1010 // Always inline these wrappers.
1011 wrapper->addFnAttr(llvm::Attribute::AlwaysInline);
1012
1013 builder->restoreIP(here);
1014
1015 llvm::verifyFunction(*wrapper);
1016 return wrapper;
1017}
1018
1019Value *CodeGen_Hexagon::create_bitcast(Value *v, llvm::Type *ty) {
1020 if (BitCastInst *c = dyn_cast<BitCastInst>(v)) {
1021 return create_bitcast(c->getOperand(0), ty);
1022 } else if (isa<UndefValue>(v)) {
1023 return UndefValue::get(ty);
1024 } else if (v->getType() != ty) {
1025 v = builder->CreateBitCast(v, ty);
1026 }
1027 return v;
1028}
1029
1030Value *CodeGen_Hexagon::call_intrin_cast(llvm::Type *ret_ty, llvm::Function *F,
1031 vector<Value *> Ops) {
1032 llvm::FunctionType *FType = F->getFunctionType();
1033 internal_assert(FType->getNumParams() == Ops.size());
1034 for (unsigned I = 0; I < FType->getNumParams(); ++I) {
1035 Ops[I] = create_bitcast(Ops[I], FType->getParamType(I));
1036 }
1037 Value *ret = builder->CreateCall(F, Ops);
1038 return create_bitcast(ret, ret_ty);
1039}
1040
1041Value *CodeGen_Hexagon::call_intrin_cast(llvm::Type *ret_ty, int id,
1042 vector<Value *> Ops) {
1043 llvm::Function *intrin =
1044 llvm::Intrinsic::getDeclaration(module.get(), (llvm::Intrinsic::ID)id);
1045 return call_intrin_cast(ret_ty, intrin, std::move(Ops));
1046}
1047
1048Value *CodeGen_Hexagon::interleave_vectors(const vector<llvm::Value *> &v) {
1049 llvm::Type *v_ty = v[0]->getType();
1050 llvm::Type *element_ty = get_vector_element_type(v_ty);
1051 int element_bits = element_ty->getScalarSizeInBits();
1052 int native_elements =
1053 native_vector_bits() / element_ty->getScalarSizeInBits();
1054 int result_elements = get_vector_num_elements(v_ty) * v.size();
1055 if (v.size() == 2) {
1056 // Interleaving two vectors.
1057 Value *a = v[0];
1058 Value *b = v[1];
1059
1060 if (result_elements == native_elements &&
1061 (element_bits == 8 || element_bits == 16)) {
1062 llvm::Type *native_ty = get_vector_type(element_ty, native_elements);
1063 // This is an interleave of two half native vectors, use
1064 // vshuff.
1065 llvm::Intrinsic::ID vshuff = element_bits == 8 ? INTRINSIC_128B(vshuffb) : INTRINSIC_128B(vshuffh);
1066 return call_intrin_cast(native_ty, vshuff,
1067 {concat_vectors({a, b})});
1068 } else {
1069 // Break them into native vectors, use vshuffvdd, and
1070 // concatenate the shuffled results.
1071 llvm::Type *native2_ty = get_vector_type(element_ty, native_elements * 2);
1072 Value *bytes = codegen(-static_cast<int>(element_bits / 8));
1073 vector<Value *> ret;
1074 for (int i = 0; i < result_elements / 2; i += native_elements) {
1075 Value *a_i = slice_vector(a, i, native_elements);
1076 Value *b_i = slice_vector(b, i, native_elements);
1077 Value *ret_i = call_intrin_cast(
1078 native2_ty,
1079 INTRINSIC_128B(vshuffvdd),
1080 {b_i, a_i, bytes});
1081 if ((i + native_elements) * 2 > result_elements) {
1082 // This is the last vector, and it has some extra
1083 // elements. Slice it down.
1084 ret_i = slice_vector(ret_i, 0, result_elements - i * 2);
1085 }
1086 ret.push_back(ret_i);
1087 }
1088 return concat_vectors(ret);
1089 }
1090 } else if (v.size() == 3) {
1091 // Interleaving 3 vectors - this generates awful code if we let LLVM do it,
1092 // so we use vdelta.
1093 Value *lut = concat_vectors(v);
1094
1095 std::vector<int> indices;
1096 for (int i = 0; i < get_vector_num_elements(v_ty); i++) {
1097 for (size_t j = 0; j < v.size(); j++) {
1098 indices.push_back(j * get_vector_num_elements(v_ty) + i);
1099 }
1100 }
1101
1102 return vdelta(lut, indices);
1103 }
1104 return CodeGen_Posix::interleave_vectors(v);
1105}
1106
1107// Check if indices form a strided ramp, allowing undef elements to
1108// pretend to be part of the ramp.
1109bool is_strided_ramp(const vector<int> &indices, int &start, int &stride) {
1110 int size = static_cast<int>(indices.size());
1111
1112 // To find the proposed start and stride, find two non-undef elements.
1113 int x0 = -1;
1114 int x1 = -1;
1115 for (int i = 0; i < size; i++) {
1116 if (indices[i] != -1) {
1117 if (x0 == -1) {
1118 x0 = i;
1119 } else {
1120 x1 = i;
1121 break;
1122 }
1123 }
1124 }
1125
1126 if (x1 == -1) {
1127 // If we don't have enough non-undef elements, we can pretend
1128 // the ramp is anything we want!
1129 stride = 1;
1130 start = x0 != -1 ? indices[x0] - x0 : 0;
1131 return true;
1132 }
1133
1134 int dx = x1 - x0;
1135 int dy = indices[x1] - indices[x0];
1136 stride = dy / dx;
1137 start = indices[x0] - stride * x0;
1138
1139 // Verify that all of the non-undef elements are part of the strided ramp.
1140 for (int i = 0; i < size; i++) {
1141 if (indices[i] != -1 && indices[i] != start + i * stride) {
1142 return false;
1143 }
1144 }
1145 return true;
1146}
1147
1148bool is_concat_or_slice(const vector<int> &indices) {
1149 // Skip undef elements at the beginning and the end.
1150 size_t begin = 0;
1151 while (begin < indices.size() && indices[begin] == -1) {
1152 ++begin;
1153 }
1154 size_t end = indices.size();
1155 while (end > 1 && indices[end - 1] == -1) {
1156 --end;
1157 }
1158
1159 // Check that the remaining elements are a dense ramp.
1160 for (size_t i = begin; i + 1 < end; i++) {
1161 if (indices[i] + 1 != indices[i + 1]) {
1162 return false;
1163 }
1164 }
1165
1166 return true;
1167}
1168
1169Value *CodeGen_Hexagon::shuffle_vectors(Value *a, Value *b,
1170 const vector<int> &indices) {
1171 llvm::Type *a_ty = a->getType();
1172 llvm::Type *b_ty = b->getType();
1173 internal_assert(a_ty == b_ty);
1174
1175 int a_elements = static_cast<int>(get_vector_num_elements(a_ty));
1176
1177 llvm::Type *element_ty = get_vector_element_type(a->getType());
1178 internal_assert(element_ty);
1179 int element_bits = element_ty->getScalarSizeInBits();
1180 int native_elements = native_vector_bits() / element_bits;
1181 llvm::Type *native_ty = get_vector_type(element_ty, native_elements);
1182 llvm::Type *native2_ty = get_vector_type(element_ty, native_elements * 2);
1183
1184 int result_elements = static_cast<int>(indices.size());
1185 internal_assert(result_elements > 0);
1186 llvm::Type *result_ty = get_vector_type(element_ty, result_elements);
1187
1188 // Try to rewrite shuffles that only access the elements of b.
1189 int min = indices[0];
1190 for (size_t i = 1; i < indices.size(); i++) {
1191 if (indices[i] != -1 && indices[i] < min) {
1192 min = indices[i];
1193 }
1194 }
1195 if (min >= a_elements) {
1196 vector<int> shifted_indices(indices);
1197 for (int &i : shifted_indices) {
1198 if (i != -1) {
1199 i -= a_elements;
1200 }
1201 }
1202 return shuffle_vectors(b, UndefValue::get(b->getType()), shifted_indices);
1203 }
1204
1205 // Try to rewrite shuffles that only access the elements of a.
1206 int max = *std::max_element(indices.begin(), indices.end());
1207 if (max < a_elements) {
1208 BitCastInst *a_cast = dyn_cast<BitCastInst>(a);
1209 CallInst *a_call = dyn_cast<CallInst>(a_cast ? a_cast->getOperand(0) : a);
1210 llvm::Function *vcombine = llvm::Intrinsic::getDeclaration(
1211 module.get(),
1212 INTRINSIC_128B(vcombine));
1213 if (a_call && a_call->getCalledFunction() == vcombine) {
1214 // Rewrite shuffle(vcombine(a, b), x) to shuffle(a, b)
1215 return shuffle_vectors(
1216 create_bitcast(a_call->getArgOperand(1), native_ty),
1217 create_bitcast(a_call->getArgOperand(0), native_ty), indices);
1218 } else if (ShuffleVectorInst *a_shuffle = dyn_cast<ShuffleVectorInst>(a)) {
1219 bool is_identity = true;
1220 for (int i = 0; i < a_elements; i++) {
1221 int mask_i = a_shuffle->getMaskValue(i);
1222 is_identity = is_identity && (mask_i == i || mask_i == -1);
1223 }
1224 if (is_identity) {
1225 return shuffle_vectors(a_shuffle->getOperand(0),
1226 a_shuffle->getOperand(1), indices);
1227 }
1228 }
1229 }
1230
1231 // Try to rewrite shuffles of (maybe strided) ramps.
1232 int start = 0, stride = 0;
1233 if (!is_strided_ramp(indices, start, stride)) {
1234 if (is_concat_or_slice(indices)) {
1235 // Let LLVM handle concat or slices.
1236 return CodeGen_Posix::shuffle_vectors(a, b, indices);
1237 }
1238 return vdelta(concat_vectors({a, b}), indices);
1239 }
1240
1241 if (stride == 1) {
1242 if (result_ty == native2_ty && a_ty == native_ty && b_ty == native_ty) {
1243 // This is a concatenation of a and b, where a and b are
1244 // native vectors. Use vcombine.
1245 internal_assert(start == 0);
1246 return call_intrin_cast(native2_ty,
1247 INTRINSIC_128B(vcombine),
1248 {b, a});
1249 }
1250 if (result_ty == native_ty && a_ty == native2_ty && max < a_elements) {
1251 // Extract a and b from a double vector.
1252 b = call_intrin_cast(native_ty, INTRINSIC_128B(hi), {a});
1253 a = call_intrin_cast(native_ty, INTRINSIC_128B(lo), {a});
1254 a_ty = a->getType();
1255 b_ty = b->getType();
1256 a_elements = get_vector_num_elements(a_ty);
1257 }
1258 if (start == 0 && result_ty == a_ty) {
1259 return a;
1260 }
1261 if (start == a_elements && result_ty == b_ty) {
1262 return b;
1263 }
1264 if (result_ty == native_ty && a_ty == native_ty && b_ty == native_ty) {
1265 // Use valign to select a subset of the concatenation of a
1266 // and b.
1267 int bytes_off = start * (element_bits / 8);
1268 int reverse_bytes = (native_vector_bits() / 8) - bytes_off;
1269 llvm::Intrinsic::ID intrin_id =
1270 INTRINSIC_128B(valignb);
1271 // v(l)align is a bit more efficient if the offset fits in
1272 // 3 bits, so if the offset is with in 3 bits from the
1273 // high end, use vlalign instead.
1274 if (bytes_off <= 7) {
1275 intrin_id = INTRINSIC_128B(valignbi);
1276 } else if (reverse_bytes <= 7) {
1277 intrin_id = INTRINSIC_128B(vlalignbi);
1278 bytes_off = reverse_bytes;
1279 }
1280 return call_intrin_cast(native_ty, intrin_id, {b, a, codegen(bytes_off)});
1281 }
1282 return CodeGen_Posix::shuffle_vectors(a, b, indices);
1283 } else if (stride == 2) {
1284 internal_assert(start == 0 || start == 1);
1285 // For stride 2 shuffles, we can use vpack or vdeal.
1286 // It's hard to use call_intrin here. We'll just slice and
1287 // concat manually.
1288 Value *ab = max < a_elements ? a : concat_vectors({a, b});
1289 vector<Value *> ret;
1290 for (int i = 0; i < result_elements; i += native_elements) {
1291 Value *ab_i0 = slice_vector(ab, i * 2, native_elements);
1292 Value *ab_i1 = slice_vector(ab, i * 2 + native_elements, native_elements);
1293 Value *ret_i;
1294 if (element_bits == 8) {
1295 llvm::Intrinsic::ID intrin = start == 0 ? INTRINSIC_128B(vpackeb) : INTRINSIC_128B(vpackob);
1296 ret_i =
1297 call_intrin_cast(native_ty, intrin, {ab_i1, ab_i0});
1298 } else if (element_bits == 16) {
1299 llvm::Intrinsic::ID intrin = start == 0 ? INTRINSIC_128B(vpackeh) : INTRINSIC_128B(vpackoh);
1300 ret_i =
1301 call_intrin_cast(native_ty, intrin, {ab_i1, ab_i0});
1302 } else if (element_bits % 8 == 0) {
1303 // Need to use vdealw, followed by lo/hi.
1304 // TODO: Is there a better instruction? This generates a
1305 // double vector, then only uses half of the result.
1306 int element_bytes = element_bits / 8;
1307 Value *packed = call_intrin_cast(
1308 native2_ty,
1309 INTRINSIC_128B(vdealvdd),
1310 {ab_i1, ab_i0, ConstantInt::get(i32_t, -element_bytes)});
1311 llvm::Intrinsic::ID intrin = start == 0 ? INTRINSIC_128B(lo) : INTRINSIC_128B(hi);
1312 ret_i = call_intrin_cast(native_ty, intrin, {packed});
1313 } else {
1314 return CodeGen_Posix::shuffle_vectors(a, b, indices);
1315 }
1316 if (i + native_elements > result_elements) {
1317 // This is the last vector, and it has a few extra
1318 // elements. Slice it down.
1319 ret_i = slice_vector(ret_i, 0, result_elements - i);
1320 }
1321 ret.push_back(ret_i);
1322 }
1323 return concat_vectors(ret);
1324 }
1325
1326 // TODO: There are more HVX permute instructions that could be
1327 // implemented here, such as vdelta/vrdelta.
1328
1329 return vlut(concat_vectors({a, b}), indices);
1330}
1331
1332Value *CodeGen_Hexagon::vlut256(Value *lut, Value *idx, int min_index,
1333 int max_index) {
1334 llvm::Type *lut_ty = lut->getType();
1335 llvm::Type *idx_ty = idx->getType();
1336
1337 internal_assert(isa<VectorType>(lut_ty));
1338 internal_assert(isa<VectorType>(idx_ty));
1339 internal_assert(idx_ty->getScalarSizeInBits() == 8);
1340 internal_assert(min_index >= 0);
1341 internal_assert(max_index < 256);
1342
1343 llvm::Intrinsic::ID vlut, vlut_acc, vshuff;
1344 if (lut_ty->getScalarSizeInBits() == 8) {
1345 // We can use vlut32.
1346 vlut = INTRINSIC_128B(vlutvvb);
1347 vlut_acc = INTRINSIC_128B(vlutvvb_oracc);
1348 vshuff = INTRINSIC_128B(vshuffb);
1349 } else {
1350 // We can use vlut16.
1351 vlut = INTRINSIC_128B(vlutvwh);
1352 vlut_acc = INTRINSIC_128B(vlutvwh_oracc);
1353 vshuff = INTRINSIC_128B(vshuffh);
1354 }
1355
1356 // There are two dimensions in which we need to slice up the
1357 // inputs. First, if the index is larger than a native vector, we
1358 // need to slice up the operation into native vectors of
1359 // indices. Second, the LUT may need to be broken into several
1360 // stages, and that may need to be further broken up into select
1361 // operations.
1362
1363 // Split up the LUT into native vectors, using the max_index to
1364 // indicate how many we need.
1365 max_index =
1366 std::min(max_index, get_vector_num_elements(lut_ty) - 1);
1367 int native_idx_elements = native_vector_bits() / 8;
1368 int native_lut_elements =
1369 native_vector_bits() / lut_ty->getScalarSizeInBits();
1370
1371 // The vlut instructions work on pairs of LUTs interleaved, with
1372 // each lut containing lut_slice_elements. We need to interleave
1373 // pairs of the native LUTs to make a full set of native LUTs.
1374 vector<Value *> lut_slices;
1375 for (int i = 0; i <= max_index; i += native_lut_elements) {
1376 Value *lut_slice = slice_vector(lut, i, native_lut_elements);
1377 lut_slice = call_intrin_cast(lut_slice->getType(), vshuff,
1378 {lut_slice});
1379 lut_slices.push_back(lut_slice);
1380 }
1381 internal_assert(!lut_slices.empty());
1382
1383 llvm::Type *native_result_ty = get_vector_type(
1384 get_vector_element_type(lut_ty), native_idx_elements);
1385
1386 // The result will have the same number of elements as idx.
1387 int idx_elements = get_vector_num_elements(idx_ty);
1388
1389 // Each LUT has 1 pair of even/odd mask values for HVX 64, 2 for
1390 // HVX 128. We may not need all of the passes, if the LUT has
1391 // fewer than half of the elements in an HVX 128 vector.
1392 constexpr int lut_passes = 2;
1393
1394 vector<Value *> result;
1395 for (int i = 0; i < idx_elements; i += native_idx_elements) {
1396 Value *idx_i = slice_vector(idx, i, native_idx_elements);
1397
1398 if (lut_ty->getScalarSizeInBits() == 16) {
1399 // vlut16 deinterleaves its output. We can either
1400 // interleave the result, or the indices. It's slightly
1401 // cheaper to interleave the indices (they are single
1402 // vectors, vs. the result which is a double vector), and
1403 // if the indices are constant (which is true for boundary
1404 // conditions) this should get lifted out of any loops.
1405 idx_i = call_intrin_cast(
1406 idx_i->getType(),
1407 INTRINSIC_128B(vshuffb), {idx_i});
1408 }
1409
1410 Value *result_i = nullptr;
1411 for (int j = 0; j < static_cast<int>(lut_slices.size()); j++) {
1412 for (int k = 0; k < lut_passes; k++) {
1413 int pass_index = lut_passes * j + k;
1414 Value *mask[2] = {
1415 ConstantInt::get(i32_t, 2 * pass_index + 0),
1416 ConstantInt::get(i32_t, 2 * pass_index + 1),
1417 };
1418 if (result_i == nullptr) {
1419 // The first native LUT, use vlut.
1420 result_i = call_intrin_cast(native_result_ty, vlut,
1421 {idx_i, lut_slices[j], mask[0]});
1422 result_i =
1423 call_intrin_cast(native_result_ty, vlut_acc,
1424 {result_i, idx_i, lut_slices[j], mask[1]});
1425 } else if (max_index >= pass_index * native_lut_elements / lut_passes) {
1426 // Not the first native LUT, accumulate the LUT
1427 // with the previous result.
1428 for (int m = 0; m < 2; m++) {
1429 result_i =
1430 call_intrin_cast(native_result_ty, vlut_acc,
1431 {result_i, idx_i, lut_slices[j], mask[m]});
1432 }
1433 }
1434 }
1435 }
1436
1437 result.push_back(result_i);
1438 }
1439 return slice_vector(concat_vectors(result), 0, idx_elements);
1440}
1441
1442bool is_power_of_two(int x) {
1443 return (x & (x - 1)) == 0;
1444}
1445
1446// vdelta and vrdelta are instructions that take an input vector and
1447// pass it through a network made up of levels. Each element x at each
1448// level i can either take the element from the previous level at the
1449// same position x, or take the element from the previous level at y,
1450// where y is x with the bit at position i flipped. This forms a
1451// butterfly network. vdelta and vrdelta have the same structure,
1452// except the ordering of the levels is flipped.
1453
1454// Find a descriptor of the path between x1 and x2. To find the path
1455// between element x1 and element x2, the algorithm is the same for
1456// both vdelta and vrdelta. To get from x1 to x2, we need to take the
1457// switch path at level i if bit i of x1 and x2 are not the same. The
1458// path is an integer where the bit at position i indicates the switch
1459// that jumps by i elements should be on.
1460int generate_delta_path(int x1, int x2) {
1461 int result = 0;
1462 for (int delta = 1; x1 != x2; delta *= 2) {
1463 if ((x1 & delta) != (x2 & delta)) {
1464 result |= delta;
1465 }
1466 x1 &= ~delta;
1467 x2 &= ~delta;
1468 }
1469 return result;
1470}
1471
1472// Generate the switch descriptors for a vdelta or vrdelta
1473// instruction. To do this, we need to generate the switch descriptors
1474// of each output to input path, and then make sure that none of the
1475// switches need conflicting settings.
1476bool generate_vdelta(const std::vector<int> &indices, bool reverse,
1477 std::vector<int> &switches) {
1478 int width = (int)indices.size();
1479 internal_assert(is_power_of_two(width));
1480 switches.resize(width);
1481
1482 // For each switch bit, we have a bit indicating whether we
1483 // already care about the switch position.
1484 std::vector<int> switches_used(switches.size());
1485 std::fill(switches.begin(), switches.end(), 0);
1486 std::fill(switches_used.begin(), switches_used.end(), 0);
1487
1488 for (int out = 0; out < width; out++) {
1489 int in = indices[out];
1490 if (in == -1) {
1491 // We don't care what the output is at this index.
1492 continue;
1493 }
1494 int path = generate_delta_path(out, in);
1495 int x = out;
1496 // Follow the path backwards, setting the switches we need as
1497 // we go. This is the only place where vdelta and vrdelta
1498 // differ. For vdelta, we start with the small jumps, vrdelta
1499 // starts with the large jumps.
1500 int start = reverse ? (1 << 30) : 1;
1501 for (int delta = start; path != 0;
1502 delta = reverse ? delta / 2 : delta * 2) {
1503 int switch_state = path & delta;
1504 if ((switches_used[x] & delta) != 0) {
1505 // This switch is already set...
1506 if ((switches[x] & delta) != switch_state) {
1507 // ... and it is set to the wrong thing. We can't represent this
1508 // shuffle.
1509 return false;
1510 }
1511 } else {
1512 // This switch is not already set, set it to the value we want, and mark
1513 // it used.
1514 switches_used[x] |= delta;
1515 switches[x] |= switch_state;
1516 }
1517 // Update our position in the network.
1518 if (switch_state) {
1519 x ^= delta;
1520 }
1521 path &= ~delta;
1522 }
1523 }
1524 return true;
1525}
1526
1527// Try generating vdelta/vrdelta before falling back to vlut.
1528Value *CodeGen_Hexagon::vdelta(Value *lut, const vector<int> &indices) {
1529 llvm::Type *lut_ty = lut->getType();
1530 int lut_elements = get_vector_num_elements(lut_ty);
1531 llvm::Type *element_ty = get_vector_element_type(lut_ty);
1532 int element_bits = element_ty->getScalarSizeInBits();
1533 int native_elements =
1534 native_vector_bits() / element_ty->getScalarSizeInBits();
1535 int result_elements = indices.size();
1536
1537 // If the input is not a vector of 8 bit elements, replicate the
1538 // indices and cast the LUT.
1539 if (element_bits != 8) {
1540 int replicate = element_bits / 8;
1541 internal_assert(replicate != 0);
1542 llvm::Type *new_lut_ty = get_vector_type(i8_t, lut_elements * replicate);
1543 Value *i8_lut = builder->CreateBitCast(lut, new_lut_ty);
1544 vector<int> i8_indices(indices.size() * replicate);
1545 for (size_t i = 0; i < indices.size(); i++) {
1546 for (int j = 0; j < replicate; j++) {
1547 i8_indices[i * replicate + j] = indices[i] * replicate + j;
1548 }
1549 }
1550 Value *result = vdelta(i8_lut, i8_indices);
1551 llvm::Type *result_ty = get_vector_type(get_vector_element_type(lut_ty), indices.size());
1552 return builder->CreateBitCast(result, result_ty);
1553 }
1554
1555 // We can only use vdelta to produce a single native vector at a
1556 // time. Break the input into native vector length shuffles.
1557 if (result_elements != native_elements) {
1558 vector<llvm::Value *> ret;
1559 for (int i = 0; i < result_elements; i += native_elements) {
1560 vector<int> indices_i(native_elements);
1561 for (int j = 0; j < native_elements; j++) {
1562 if (i + j < result_elements) {
1563 indices_i[j] = indices[i + j];
1564 } else {
1565 indices_i[j] = -1;
1566 }
1567 }
1568 Value *ret_i = vdelta(lut, indices_i);
1569 if (result_elements - i < native_elements) {
1570 // This was a fractional vector at the end, slice the part we want.
1571 ret_i = slice_vector(ret_i, 0, result_elements - i);
1572 }
1573 ret.push_back(ret_i);
1574 }
1575 return concat_vectors(ret);
1576 }
1577
1578 internal_assert(result_elements == native_elements);
1579
1580 // We can only use vdelta to shuffle a single native vector of
1581 // input. If we have more than one, we need to break it into
1582 // multiple vdelta operations, and combine them with select.
1583 if (lut_elements != native_elements) {
1584 Value *ret = nullptr;
1585 for (int i = 0; i < lut_elements; i += native_elements) {
1586 Value *lut_i = slice_vector(lut, i, native_elements);
1587 vector<int> indices_i(native_elements);
1588 vector<Constant *> mask(native_elements);
1589 bool all_used = true;
1590 bool none_used = true;
1591 for (int j = 0; j < native_elements; j++) {
1592 int idx = indices[j] - i;
1593 if (0 <= idx && idx < native_elements) {
1594 indices_i[j] = idx;
1595 mask[j] = ConstantInt::get(i1_t, 1);
1596 none_used = false;
1597 } else {
1598 indices_i[j] = -1;
1599 mask[j] = ConstantInt::get(i1_t, 0);
1600 all_used = false;
1601 }
1602 }
1603 Value *ret_i = vdelta(lut_i, indices_i);
1604 if (all_used || ret == nullptr) {
1605 // If the mask is all ones, or this is the first result, we don't need
1606 // to preserve past results.
1607 ret = ret_i;
1608 } else if (!none_used) {
1609 // Create a condition value for which elements of the range are valid
1610 // for this index.
1611 ret = builder->CreateSelect(ConstantVector::get(mask), ret_i, ret);
1612 }
1613 }
1614 return ret;
1615 }
1616
1617 // We now have a single native vector to native vector shuffle. Try
1618 // Generating a vdelta or vrdelta.
1619 for (bool reverse : {false, true}) {
1620 std::vector<int> switches;
1621 if (generate_vdelta(indices, reverse, switches)) {
1622 vector<Constant *> control_elements(switches.size());
1623 for (int i = 0; i < (int)switches.size(); i++) {
1624 control_elements[i] = ConstantInt::get(i8_t, switches[i]);
1625 }
1626 Value *control = ConstantVector::get(control_elements);
1627 llvm::Intrinsic::ID vdelta = reverse ? INTRINSIC_128B(vrdelta) : INTRINSIC_128B(vdelta);
1628 return call_intrin_cast(lut_ty, vdelta, {lut, control});
1629 }
1630 }
1631
1632 // TODO: If the above fails, we might be able to use a vdelta and
1633 // vrdelta instruction together to implement the shuffle.
1634 // TODO: If the vdelta results are sparsely used, it might be
1635 // better to use vlut.
1636 return vlut(lut, indices);
1637}
1638
1639Value *create_vector(llvm::Type *ty, int val) {
1640 llvm::Type *scalar_ty = ty->getScalarType();
1641 Constant *value = ConstantInt::get(scalar_ty, val);
1642 return ConstantVector::getSplat(element_count(get_vector_num_elements(ty)), value);
1643}
1644
1645Value *CodeGen_Hexagon::vlut(Value *lut, Value *idx, int min_index, int max_index) {
1646 const unsigned idx_elem_size = idx->getType()->getScalarSizeInBits();
1647 internal_assert(idx_elem_size <= 16)
1648 << "Index element for lookup tables must be <= 16 bits in size.\n";
1649 llvm::Type *lut_ty = lut->getType();
1650 llvm::Type *result_ty = get_vector_type(get_vector_element_type(lut_ty),
1651 get_vector_num_elements(idx->getType()));
1652 const unsigned idx_elems = get_vector_num_elements(idx->getType());
1653
1654 // Construct a new index with 16-bit elements.
1655 unsigned idx16_elems = idx_elems;
1656 Value *idx16 = (idx_elem_size == 8) ?
1657 call_intrin(get_vector_type(i16_t, idx_elems),
1658 "halide.hexagon.unpack.vub", {idx}) :
1659 idx;
1660
1661 const int replicate = lut_ty->getScalarSizeInBits() / 16;
1662 if (replicate > 1) {
1663 // Replicate the LUT indices and use vlut16.
1664 // For LUT32: create two indices:
1665 // - 2 * index
1666 // - 2 * index + 1
1667 // Interleave the two index vectors and use vlut16 with the new index
1668 // vector.
1669 vector<Value *> indices;
1670 Value *replicate_val = ConstantInt::get(i8_t, replicate);
1671 for (int i = 0; i < replicate; i++) {
1672 Value *pos = ConstantInt::get(idx16->getType(), i);
1673 indices.emplace_back(call_intrin(idx16->getType(),
1674 "halide.hexagon.add_mul.vh.vh.b",
1675 {pos, idx16, replicate_val}));
1676 }
1677 idx16 = interleave_vectors(indices);
1678 idx16_elems *= replicate;
1679 min_index = min_index * replicate;
1680 max_index = (max_index + 1) * replicate - 1;
1681 internal_assert(max_index <= 32676)
1682 << "Index range for lookup table must be <= 32676\n";
1683 lut_ty = get_vector_type(i16_t,
1684 get_vector_num_elements(lut_ty) * replicate);
1685 lut = builder->CreateBitCast(lut, lut_ty);
1686 }
1687
1688 llvm::Type *i8x_t = get_vector_type(i8_t, idx16_elems);
1689 llvm::Type *i16x_t = get_vector_type(i16_t, idx16_elems);
1690 Value *minus_one = create_vector(i16x_t, -1);
1691
1692 // If we can do this with one vlut, do it now.
1693 if (max_index < 256) {
1694 // If the idx already had 8 bit elements and no replication was needed,
1695 // we can use idx else we need to pack idx16.
1696 Value *idx8 = (idx_elem_size == 16 || idx_elems != idx16_elems) ?
1697 call_intrin(i8x_t, "halide.hexagon.pack.vh", {idx16}) :
1698 idx;
1699 Value *result_val = vlut256(lut, idx8, min_index, max_index);
1700 return builder->CreateBitCast(result_val, result_ty);
1701 }
1702 // We need to break the index up into ranges of up to 256, and select
1703 // the ranges together after using vlut on each range. This vector
1704 // contains the result of each range, and a condition vector
1705 // indicating whether the result should be used.
1706 vector<std::pair<Value *, Value *>> ranges;
1707 for (int min_index_i = 0; min_index_i < max_index; min_index_i += 256) {
1708 // Make a vector of the indices shifted such that the min of
1709 // this range is at 0. Use 16-bit indices for this.
1710 Value *min_index_i_val = create_vector(i16x_t, min_index_i);
1711 Value *indices = builder->CreateSub(idx16, min_index_i_val);
1712
1713 // Create a condition value for which elements of the range are valid
1714 // for this index.
1715 Value *use_index = builder->CreateICmpSGT(indices, minus_one);
1716
1717 // After we've eliminated the invalid elements, we can
1718 // truncate to 8 bits, as vlut requires.
1719 indices = call_intrin(i8x_t, "halide.hexagon.pack.vh", {indices});
1720
1721 int range_extent_i = std::min(max_index - min_index_i, 255);
1722 Value *range_i = vlut256(slice_vector(lut, min_index_i, range_extent_i),
1723 indices, 0, range_extent_i);
1724 ranges.emplace_back(range_i, use_index);
1725 }
1726
1727 // TODO: This could be reduced hierarchically instead of in
1728 // order. However, this requires the condition for the select to be
1729 // quite tricky.
1730 Value *result = ranges[0].first;
1731 for (size_t i = 1; i < ranges.size(); i++) {
1732 result = builder->CreateSelect(ranges[i].second, ranges[i].first, result);
1733 }
1734 return builder->CreateBitCast(result, result_ty);
1735}
1736
1737Value *CodeGen_Hexagon::vlut(Value *lut, const vector<int> &indices) {
1738 // TODO: We can take advantage of the fact that we know the
1739 // indices at compile time to implement a few
1740 // optimizations. First, we can avoid running the vlut
1741 // instructions for ranges of the LUT for which we know we don't
1742 // have any indices. This wil happen often for strided
1743 // ramps. Second, we can do the shuffling of the indices necessary
1744 // at compile time.
1745 vector<Constant *> llvm_indices;
1746 llvm_indices.reserve(indices.size());
1747 int min_index = get_vector_num_elements(lut->getType());
1748 int max_index = 0;
1749 for (int i : indices) {
1750 if (i != -1) {
1751 min_index = std::min(min_index, i);
1752 max_index = std::max(max_index, i);
1753 }
1754 llvm_indices.push_back(ConstantInt::get(i16_t, i));
1755 }
1756
1757 // We use i16 indices because we can't support LUTs with more than
1758 // 32k elements anyways without massive stack spilling (the LUT
1759 // must fit in registers), and it costs some runtime performance
1760 // due to the conversion to 8 bit. This is also crazy and should
1761 // never happen.
1762 internal_assert(max_index < std::numeric_limits<int16_t>::max())
1763 << "vlut of more than 32k elements not supported \n";
1764
1765 return vlut(lut, ConstantVector::get(llvm_indices), min_index, max_index);
1766}
1767
1768Value *CodeGen_Hexagon::call_intrin(Type result_type, const string &name,
1769 vector<Expr> args, bool maybe) {
1770 llvm::Function *fn = module->getFunction(name);
1771 if (maybe && !fn) {
1772 return nullptr;
1773 }
1774 internal_assert(fn) << "Function '" << name << "' not found\n";
1775 if (get_vector_num_elements(fn->getReturnType()) * 2 <=
1776 result_type.lanes()) {
1777 // We have fewer than half as many lanes in our intrinsic as
1778 // we have in the call. Check to see if a double vector
1779 // version of this intrinsic exists.
1780 llvm::Function *fn2 = module->getFunction(name + ".dv");
1781 if (fn2) {
1782 fn = fn2;
1783 }
1784 }
1785 fn->addFnAttr(llvm::Attribute::ReadNone);
1786 fn->addFnAttr(llvm::Attribute::NoUnwind);
1787 return CodeGen_Posix::call_intrin(result_type, get_vector_num_elements(fn->getReturnType()),
1788 fn, std::move(args));
1789}
1790
1791Value *CodeGen_Hexagon::call_intrin(llvm::Type *result_type, const string &name,
1792 vector<Value *> args, bool maybe) {
1793 llvm::Function *fn = module->getFunction(name);
1794 if (maybe && !fn) {
1795 return nullptr;
1796 }
1797 internal_assert(fn) << "Function '" << name << "' not found\n";
1798 if (get_vector_num_elements(fn->getReturnType()) * 2 <=
1799 get_vector_num_elements(result_type)) {
1800 // We have fewer than half as many lanes in our intrinsic as
1801 // we have in the call. Check to see if a double vector
1802 // version of this intrinsic exists.
1803 llvm::Function *fn2 = module->getFunction(name + ".dv");
1804 if (fn2) {
1805 fn = fn2;
1806 }
1807 }
1808 fn->addFnAttr(llvm::Attribute::ReadNone);
1809 fn->addFnAttr(llvm::Attribute::NoUnwind);
1810 return CodeGen_Posix::call_intrin(result_type, get_vector_num_elements(fn->getReturnType()),
1811 fn, std::move(args));
1812}
1813
1814string CodeGen_Hexagon::mcpu() const {
1815 if (target.has_feature(Halide::Target::HVX_v66)) {
1816 return "hexagonv66";
1817 } else if (target.has_feature(Halide::Target::HVX_v65)) {
1818 return "hexagonv65";
1819 } else {
1820 return "hexagonv62";
1821 }
1822}
1823
1824string CodeGen_Hexagon::mattrs() const {
1825 std::stringstream attrs;
1826 attrs << "+hvx-length128b";
1827 attrs << ",+long-calls";
1828 if (target.has_feature(Target::HVX)) {
1829 attrs << ",+hvxv" << isa_version;
1830 }
1831 return attrs.str();
1832}
1833
1834bool CodeGen_Hexagon::use_soft_float_abi() const {
1835 return false;
1836}
1837
1838int CodeGen_Hexagon::native_vector_bits() const {
1839 return 128 * 8;
1840}
1841
1842Expr maybe_scalar(Expr x) {
1843 const Broadcast *xb = x.as<Broadcast>();
1844 if (xb) {
1845 return xb->value;
1846 } else {
1847 return x;
1848 }
1849}
1850
1851void CodeGen_Hexagon::visit(const Mul *op) {
1852 if (op->type.is_vector()) {
1853 value =
1854 call_intrin(op->type, "halide.hexagon.mul" + type_suffix(op->a, op->b),
1855 {op->a, op->b}, true /*maybe*/);
1856 if (value) {
1857 return;
1858 }
1859
1860 // Hexagon has mostly widening multiplies. Try to find a
1861 // widening multiply we can use.
1862 // TODO: It would probably be better to just define a bunch of
1863 // mul.*.* functions in the runtime HVX modules so the above
1864 // implementation can be used unconditionally.
1865 value =
1866 call_intrin(op->type, "halide.hexagon.mpy" + type_suffix(op->a, op->b),
1867 {op->a, op->b}, true /*maybe*/);
1868 if (value) {
1869 // We found a widening op, we need to narrow back
1870 // down. The widening multiply deinterleaved the result,
1871 // but the trunc operation reinterleaves.
1872 Type wide = op->type.widen();
1873 value = call_intrin(llvm_type_of(op->type),
1874 "halide.hexagon.trunc" + type_suffix(wide, false),
1875 {value});
1876 return;
1877 }
1878
1879 internal_error << "Unhandled HVX multiply " << op->a.type() << "*"
1880 << op->b.type() << "\n"
1881 << Expr(op) << "\n";
1882 } else {
1883 CodeGen_Posix::visit(op);
1884 }
1885}
1886
1887void CodeGen_Hexagon::visit(const Call *op) {
1888 internal_assert(op->is_extern() || op->is_intrinsic())
1889 << "Can only codegen extern calls and intrinsics\n";
1890
1891 // Map Halide functions to Hexagon intrinsics, plus a boolean
1892 // indicating if the intrinsic has signed variants or not.
1893 static std::map<string, std::pair<string, bool>> functions = {
1894 {Call::get_intrinsic_name(Call::absd), {"halide.hexagon.absd", true}},
1895 {Call::get_intrinsic_name(Call::halving_add), {"halide.hexagon.avg", true}},
1896 {Call::get_intrinsic_name(Call::rounding_halving_add), {"halide.hexagon.avg_rnd", true}},
1897 {Call::get_intrinsic_name(Call::halving_sub), {"halide.hexagon.navg", true}},
1898 {Call::get_intrinsic_name(Call::saturating_add), {"halide.hexagon.sat_add", true}},
1899 {Call::get_intrinsic_name(Call::saturating_sub), {"halide.hexagon.sat_sub", true}},
1900 };
1901
1902 if (is_native_interleave(op)) {
1903 internal_assert(
1904 op->type.lanes() % (native_vector_bits() * 2 / op->type.bits()) == 0);
1905 }
1906
1907 if (starts_with(op->name, "halide.hexagon.")) {
1908 // Handle all of the intrinsics we generated in
1909 // hexagon_optimize. I'm not sure why this is different than
1910 // letting it fall through to CodeGen_LLVM.
1911 value = call_intrin(op->type, op->name, op->args);
1912 return;
1913 }
1914
1915 if (op->type.is_vector()) {
1916 auto i = functions.find(op->name);
1917 if (i != functions.end()) {
1918 string intrin = i->second.first + type_suffix(op->args, i->second.second);
1919 value = call_intrin(op->type, intrin, op->args, true /*maybe*/);
1920 if (value) {
1921 return;
1922 }
1923 } else if (op->is_intrinsic(Call::shift_left) ||
1924 op->is_intrinsic(Call::shift_right)) {
1925 internal_assert(op->args.size() == 2);
1926 string instr = op->is_intrinsic(Call::shift_left) ? "halide.hexagon.shl" : "halide.hexagon.shr";
1927 Expr b = maybe_scalar(op->args[1]);
1928 // Make b signed. Shifts are only well defined if this wouldn't overflow.
1929 b = cast(b.type().with_code(Type::Int), b);
1930 value = call_intrin(op->type,
1931 instr + type_suffix(op->args[0], b),
1932 {op->args[0], b});
1933 return;
1934 } else if (op->is_intrinsic(Call::dynamic_shuffle)) {
1935 internal_assert(op->args.size() == 4);
1936 const int64_t *min_index = as_const_int(op->args[2]);
1937 const int64_t *max_index = as_const_int(op->args[3]);
1938 internal_assert(min_index && max_index);
1939 Value *lut = codegen(op->args[0]);
1940 Value *idx = codegen(op->args[1]);
1941 value = vlut(lut, idx, *min_index, *max_index);
1942 return;
1943 } else if (op->is_intrinsic(Call::abs)) {
1944 internal_assert(op->args.size() == 1);
1945 Type ty = op->args[0].type();
1946 if ((ty.is_vector() && ty.is_int())) {
1947 if (ty.bits() != 8 || is_hvx_v65_or_later()) {
1948 value = call_intrin(op->type,
1949 "halide.hexagon.abs" + type_suffix(op->args[0]),
1950 op->args);
1951 return;
1952 }
1953 }
1954 } else if (op->is_intrinsic(Call::cast_mask)) {
1955 internal_error
1956 << "cast_mask should already have been handled in HexagonOptimize\n";
1957 }
1958 }
1959
1960 if (op->is_intrinsic(Call::prefetch)) {
1961 internal_assert((op->args.size() == 4) || (op->args.size() == 6))
1962 << "Hexagon only supports 1D or 2D prefetch\n";
1963
1964 vector<llvm::Value *> args;
1965 args.push_back(
1966 codegen_buffer_pointer(codegen(op->args[0]), op->type, op->args[1]));
1967
1968 Expr extent_0_bytes = op->args[2] * op->args[3] * op->type.bytes();
1969 args.push_back(codegen(extent_0_bytes));
1970
1971 llvm::Function *prefetch_fn = nullptr;
1972 if (op->args.size() ==
1973 4) { // 1D prefetch: {base, offset, extent0, stride0}
1974 prefetch_fn = module->getFunction("_halide_prefetch");
1975 } else { // 2D prefetch: {base, offset, extent0, stride0, extent1, stride1}
1976 prefetch_fn = module->getFunction("_halide_prefetch_2d");
1977 args.push_back(codegen(op->args[4]));
1978 Expr stride_1_bytes = op->args[5] * op->type.bytes();
1979 args.push_back(codegen(stride_1_bytes));
1980 }
1981 internal_assert(prefetch_fn);
1982
1983 // The first argument is a pointer, which has type i8*. We
1984 // need to cast the argument, which might be a pointer to a
1985 // different type.
1986 llvm::Type *ptr_type = prefetch_fn->getFunctionType()->params()[0];
1987 args[0] = builder->CreateBitCast(args[0], ptr_type);
1988
1989 value = builder->CreateCall(prefetch_fn, args);
1990 return;
1991 }
1992
1993 if (op->is_intrinsic(Call::hvx_gather)) {
1994 internal_assert(op->args.size() == 5);
1995 internal_assert(op->type.bits() == 16 || op->type.bits() == 32);
1996 int index_lanes = op->type.lanes();
1997 int intrin_lanes = native_vector_bits() / op->type.bits();
1998
1999 string name = "halide.hexagon.vgather";
2000 name += (op->type.bits() == 16) ? ".h.h" : ".w.w";
2001 llvm::Function *fn = module->getFunction(name);
2002
2003 Value *dst_buffer = codegen(op->args[0]);
2004 Value *src_ptr = codegen(op->args[2]);
2005 Value *size = codegen(op->args[3]);
2006 Value *index = codegen(op->args[4]);
2007
2008 // Cut up the indices into appropriately-sized pieces.
2009 for (int start = 0; start < index_lanes; start += intrin_lanes) {
2010 vector<Value *> args;
2011 Value *new_index = slice_vector(index, start, intrin_lanes);
2012 args.push_back(dst_buffer);
2013 args.push_back(codegen(op->args[1] + start));
2014 args.push_back(src_ptr);
2015 args.push_back(size);
2016 args.push_back(new_index);
2017 value = builder->CreateCall(fn, args);
2018 }
2019 return;
2020 } else if (op->is_intrinsic(Call::hvx_scatter) ||
2021 op->is_intrinsic(Call::hvx_scatter_acc)) {
2022 internal_assert(op->args.size() == 4);
2023 internal_assert(op->type.bits() == 16 || op->type.bits() == 32);
2024 int index_lanes = op->type.lanes();
2025 int intrin_lanes = native_vector_bits() / op->type.bits();
2026
2027 string name = "halide.hexagon.vscatter";
2028 name += op->is_intrinsic(Call::hvx_scatter_acc) ? "_acc" : "";
2029 name += (op->type.bits() == 16) ? ".h.h" : ".w.w";
2030 llvm::Function *fn = module->getFunction(name);
2031
2032 Value *src_ptr = codegen(op->args[0]);
2033 Value *size = codegen(op->args[1]);
2034 Value *index = codegen(op->args[2]);
2035 Value *val = codegen(op->args[3]);
2036
2037 Value *args[4];
2038 args[0] = src_ptr;
2039 args[1] = size;
2040 // Cut up the indices into appropriately-sized pieces.
2041 for (int start = 0; start < index_lanes; start += intrin_lanes) {
2042 args[2] = slice_vector(index, start, intrin_lanes);
2043 args[3] = slice_vector(val, start, intrin_lanes);
2044 value = builder->CreateCall(fn, args);
2045 }
2046 return;
2047 } else if (op->is_intrinsic(Call::hvx_scatter_release)) {
2048 internal_assert(op->args.size() == 1);
2049 Value *ptr = codegen(op->args[0]);
2050 llvm::Function *fn = module->getFunction("halide.hexagon.scatter.release");
2051 value = builder->CreateCall(fn, {ptr});
2052 return;
2053 } else if (op->is_intrinsic(Call::sorted_avg) && op->type.is_vector() &&
2054 ((op->type.is_uint() &&
2055 (op->type.bits() == 8 || op->type.bits() == 16)) ||
2056 (op->type.is_int() &&
2057 (op->type.bits() == 16 || op->type.bits() == 32)))) {
2058 value = codegen(Call::make(
2059 op->type, "halide.hexagon.avg" + type_suffix(op->args[0], op->args[1]),
2060 {op->args[0], op->args[1]}, Call::PureExtern));
2061 return;
2062 }
2063
2064 CodeGen_Posix::visit(op);
2065}
2066
2067void CodeGen_Hexagon::visit(const Max *op) {
2068 if (op->type.is_vector()) {
2069 value =
2070 call_intrin(op->type, "halide.hexagon.max" + type_suffix(op->a, op->b),
2071 {op->a, op->b}, true /*maybe*/);
2072 if (!value) {
2073 Expr equiv = Select::make(op->a > op->b, op->a, op->b);
2074 equiv = common_subexpression_elimination(equiv);
2075 value = codegen(equiv);
2076 }
2077 } else {
2078 CodeGen_Posix::visit(op);
2079 }
2080}
2081
2082void CodeGen_Hexagon::visit(const Min *op) {
2083 if (op->type.is_vector()) {
2084 value =
2085 call_intrin(op->type, "halide.hexagon.min" + type_suffix(op->a, op->b),
2086 {op->a, op->b}, true /*maybe*/);
2087 if (!value) {
2088 Expr equiv = Select::make(op->a > op->b, op->b, op->a);
2089 equiv = common_subexpression_elimination(equiv);
2090 value = codegen(equiv);
2091 }
2092 } else {
2093 CodeGen_Posix::visit(op);
2094 }
2095}
2096
2097void CodeGen_Hexagon::visit(const Select *op) {
2098 if (op->condition.type().is_scalar() && op->type.is_vector()) {
2099 // Implement scalar conditions on vector values with if-then-else.
2100 value = codegen(Call::make(op->type, Call::if_then_else,
2101 {op->condition, op->true_value, op->false_value},
2102 Call::Intrinsic));
2103 } else {
2104 CodeGen_Posix::visit(op);
2105 }
2106}
2107
2108Value *CodeGen_Hexagon::codegen_cache_allocation_size(
2109 const std::string &name, Type type, const std::vector<Expr> &extents) {
2110 // Compute size from list of extents checking for overflow.
2111
2112 Expr overflow = make_zero(UInt(32));
2113 Expr total_size = make_const(UInt(32), type.lanes() * type.bytes());
2114
2115 // We'll multiply all the extents into the 32-bit value
2116 // total_size. We'll also track (total_size >> 24) as a 32-bit
2117 // value to check for overflow as we go. The loop invariant will
2118 // be that either the overflow Expr is non-zero, or total_size_hi
2119 // only occupies the bottom 8-bits. Overflow could be more simply
2120 // checked for using division, but that's slower at runtime. This
2121 // method generates much better assembly.
2122 Expr total_size_hi = make_zero(UInt(32));
2123
2124 Expr low_mask = make_const(UInt(32), (uint32_t)(0xfffff));
2125 for (size_t i = 0; i < extents.size(); i++) {
2126 Expr next_extent = cast(UInt(32), extents[i]);
2127
2128 // Update total_size >> 24. This math can't overflow due to
2129 // the loop invariant:
2130 total_size_hi *= next_extent;
2131 // Deal with carry from the low bits. Still can't overflow.
2132 total_size_hi += ((total_size & low_mask) * next_extent) >> 24;
2133
2134 // Update total_size. This may overflow.
2135 total_size *= next_extent;
2136
2137 // We can check for overflow by asserting that total_size_hi
2138 // is still an 8-bit number.
2139 overflow = overflow | (total_size_hi >> 24);
2140 }
2141
2142 Expr max_size = make_const(UInt(32), target.maximum_buffer_size());
2143 Expr size_check = (overflow == 0) && (total_size <= max_size);
2144
2145 // For constant-sized allocations this check should simplify away.
2146 size_check = common_subexpression_elimination(simplify(size_check));
2147 if (!is_const_one(size_check)) {
2148 create_assertion(
2149 codegen(size_check),
2150 Call::make(Int(32), "halide_error_buffer_allocation_too_large",
2151 {name, Cast::make(UInt(64), total_size),
2152 Cast::make(UInt(64), max_size)},
2153 Call::Extern));
2154 }
2155
2156 total_size = simplify(total_size);
2157 return codegen(total_size);
2158}
2159
2160void CodeGen_Hexagon::visit(const Allocate *alloc) {
2161 if (sym_exists(alloc->name)) {
2162 user_error << "Can't have two different buffers with the same name: "
2163 << alloc->name << "\n";
2164 }
2165
2166 if (alloc->memory_type == MemoryType::LockedCache) {
2167 // We are not allowing Customized memory allocation for Locked Cache
2168 user_assert(!alloc->new_expr.defined())
2169 << "Custom Expression not allowed for Memory Type Locked Cache\n";
2170
2171 Value *llvm_size = nullptr;
2172 int32_t constant_bytes =
2173 Allocate::constant_allocation_size(alloc->extents, alloc->name);
2174 if (constant_bytes > 0) {
2175 constant_bytes *= alloc->type.bytes();
2176 llvm_size = codegen(Expr(constant_bytes));
2177 } else {
2178 llvm_size = codegen_cache_allocation_size(alloc->name, alloc->type,
2179 alloc->extents);
2180 }
2181
2182 // Only allocate memory if the condition is true, otherwise 0.
2183 Value *llvm_condition = codegen(alloc->condition);
2184 if (llvm_size != nullptr) {
2185 llvm_size = builder->CreateSelect(
2186 llvm_condition, llvm_size, ConstantInt::get(llvm_size->getType(), 0));
2187 }
2188
2189 Allocation allocation;
2190 allocation.constant_bytes = constant_bytes;
2191 allocation.stack_bytes = 0;
2192 allocation.type = alloc->type;
2193 allocation.ptr = nullptr;
2194 allocation.destructor = nullptr;
2195 allocation.destructor_function = nullptr;
2196 allocation.name = alloc->name;
2197
2198 // Call Halide_Locked_Cache_Alloc
2199 llvm::Function *alloc_fn =
2200 module->getFunction("halide_locked_cache_malloc");
2201 internal_assert(alloc_fn)
2202 << "Could not find halide_locked_cache_malloc in module\n";
2203
2204 llvm::Function::arg_iterator arg_iter = alloc_fn->arg_begin();
2205 ++arg_iter; // skip the user context *
2206 llvm_size = builder->CreateIntCast(llvm_size, arg_iter->getType(), false);
2207
2208 debug(4) << "Creating call to halide_locked_cache_malloc for allocation "
2209 << alloc->name << " of size " << alloc->type.bytes();
2210 for (const Expr &e : alloc->extents) {
2211 debug(4) << " x " << e;
2212 }
2213 debug(4) << "\n";
2214 Value *args[2] = {get_user_context(), llvm_size};
2215
2216 Value *call = builder->CreateCall(alloc_fn, args);
2217
2218 // Fix the type to avoid pointless bitcasts later
2219 call = builder->CreatePointerCast(
2220 call, llvm_type_of(alloc->type)->getPointerTo());
2221 allocation.ptr = call;
2222
2223 // Assert that the allocation worked.
2224 Value *check = builder->CreateIsNotNull(allocation.ptr);
2225 if (llvm_size) {
2226 Value *zero_size = builder->CreateIsNull(llvm_size);
2227 check = builder->CreateOr(check, zero_size);
2228 }
2229 create_assertion(check, Call::make(Int(32), "halide_error_out_of_memory",
2230 std::vector<Expr>(), Call::Extern));
2231
2232 std::string free_function_string;
2233 // Register a destructor for this allocation.
2234 if (alloc->free_function.empty()) {
2235 free_function_string = "halide_locked_cache_free";
2236 }
2237 llvm::Function *free_fn = module->getFunction(free_function_string);
2238 internal_assert(free_fn)
2239 << "Could not find " << alloc->free_function << " in module.\n";
2240 allocation.destructor =
2241 register_destructor(free_fn, allocation.ptr, OnError);
2242 allocation.destructor_function = free_fn;
2243
2244 // Push the allocation base pointer onto the symbol table
2245 debug(3) << "Pushing allocation called " << alloc->name
2246 << " onto the symbol table\n";
2247 allocations.push(alloc->name, allocation);
2248
2249 sym_push(alloc->name, allocation.ptr);
2250
2251 codegen(alloc->body);
2252
2253 // If there was no early free, free it now.
2254 if (allocations.contains(alloc->name)) {
2255 Allocation alloc_obj = allocations.get(alloc->name);
2256 internal_assert(alloc_obj.destructor);
2257 trigger_destructor(alloc_obj.destructor_function, alloc_obj.destructor);
2258
2259 allocations.pop(alloc->name);
2260 sym_pop(alloc->name);
2261 }
2262 } else if (alloc->memory_type == MemoryType::VTCM &&
2263 !alloc->new_expr.defined()) {
2264 if (!is_hvx_v65_or_later()) {
2265 user_error << "VTCM store_in requires HVX_v65 or later.\n";
2266 }
2267 // Calculate size of allocation.
2268 Expr size = alloc->type.bytes();
2269 for (size_t i = 0; i < alloc->extents.size(); i++) {
2270 size *= alloc->extents[i];
2271 }
2272 size += allocation_padding(alloc->type);
2273 Expr new_expr =
2274 Call::make(Handle(), "halide_vtcm_malloc", {size}, Call::Extern);
2275 string free_function = "halide_vtcm_free";
2276 Stmt new_alloc = Allocate::make(
2277 alloc->name, alloc->type, alloc->memory_type, alloc->extents,
2278 alloc->condition, alloc->body, new_expr, free_function);
2279 new_alloc.accept(this);
2280 } else {
2281 // For all other memory types
2282 CodeGen_Posix::visit(alloc);
2283 }
2284}
2285
2286} // namespace

2288std::unique_ptr<CodeGen_Posix> new_CodeGen_Hexagon(const Target &target) {
2289 return std::make_unique<CodeGen_Hexagon>(target);
2290}

2295 user_error << "hexagon not enabled for this build of Halide.\n";
2296 return nullptr;
